quoteLast: , everybody was asleep in the village, when the cannon of Phalsbourg began to roar: it was the heavy guns on the bastion of Wilschberg, and those of the infantry barracks.  Our little houses shook.
title:
The Pl√©biscite; or, A Miller's Story of the War
By One of the 7,500,000 Who Voted "Yes"
author: Erckmann-Chatrian

quoteFirst: At four o'clock in the morning of that day our voyagers weighed, with a light breeze; but it being variable with frequent calms, they made little way. From that time till the afternoon they kept turning out of the bay, and
quoteLast: were suddenly becalmed, so that the ship could neither wear nor exactly keep her station. The tide or current setting strong, she drove toward land so fast; that before any measures could be taken for her security, she was within a cable's length of the breakers.
title:
Narrative of the Voyages Round the World, Performed by Captain James Cook
With an Account of His Life During the Previous and Intervening Periods
author: Kippis, Andrew, 1725-1795

quoteLast: ," said John. "I was fast asleep in bed, but they knocked me up; I got on my clothes and was off in five minutes. They are always glad enough to get us fishermen, the coastguard are. Mine was the first boat-load we brought ashore; we would only take women and children that time. They were all in their night-gowns, and they couldn't speak a word of English, but we made them understand somehow.
title: An Unsentimental Journey through Cornwall
author: Craik, Dinah Maria Mulock, 1826-1887; Hemy, Charles Napier, 1841-1917 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: This lengthened procession having all passed, the various figures who had performed in it assembled upon the stage and executed a melodramatic ballet, which lasted till
quoteLast: ; and the ceremonies of the day were wound up by a splendid display of fireworks.[94] It has been stated in most accounts of the baptism, that the Golden Fleece was conferred on the infant by the Marquis of Pescara in name of his master Philip III.

quoteFirst: Wythan to Wales. The two voyagers were sadder by sympathy than the two whom they were leaving to the clock's round of desert sameness.

quoteFirst: The infantry and Cobb's battery reached the ferry where it was intended that they should cross,
quoteLast: , and were put across in two small leaky boats, a difficult and tedious job. When the cavalry reached the ford, where Colonel Morgan had directed me to cross, I found that the river had risen so much since the last reconnoisance that it was past fording at that point, and I had to seek a crossing further down.
title: History of Morgan's Cavalry
author: Duke, Basil Wilson, 1838-1916

quoteFirst: By 7.30 p.m. six of our guns were across the river and the rest were now firing like field artillery, with no other batteries between them and the enemy. They kept up this protection of the retreat of the infantry so long, in fact, that the last round of all, at
quoteLast: , was fired just before the gun was hitched to the tractor, and there was yet another gun that had its breech mechanism smashed for fear it might have to be left behind.
